briefTitle: Study to Evaluate the Consistency of Three Consecutive Production Lots of Influenza Vaccine in Healthy Subjects 18 to 49 Years Old
officialTitle: A Phase III, Randomized, Controlled, Observer-Blind, Single-Center Study to Evaluate the Consistency of Three Consecutive Lots of a Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Produced in Embryonated Hen Eggs in Healthy Subjects Aged 18 to 49 Years

interventions.name: Lot A of Influenza virus vaccine
Lot B of Influenza virus vaccine
Lot C of Influenza virus vaccine
All 3 consecutive lots of influenza virus vaccine pooled

summary: The purpose of this research is to demonstrate immunologic equivalence of three consecutive production lots of the subunit influenza vaccine compared to egg-derived inactivated influenza vaccine in healthy subjects 18 to 49 years of ages. In addition, this study is to show how safe and well tolerated a conventional inactivated subunit influenza vaccine, licensed in many countries outside the United States, is compared to an inactivated influenza vaccine, licensed in the United States.

primaryOutcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs), by Vaccine Lots
